name: Crimson Whizzard
description:
1st Place Runner Deck for December '13 Tournament at Denver Central Games

Anarchs have always been my weakest Runner faction, as I struggle with putting together an efficient playstyle. I've worked around this by just play aggressively, per my usual Criminal decks, and threw in some Account Siphons to help. I'm currently 13-3 against a variety of competition with this particular iteration, and went 3-1 on the Runner side with this deck in the Denver tournament earlier today.

name: Crimson Dead
description:

My adaptation of Travis Chance's Dead You archetype.

name: Feminine Wiles
description:
3rd Place Runner Deck in December '13 Tournament at Denver Central Games

My wife's runner decklist that she went 4-0 with in the tournament.

name: Andromeda the Boss
description: this deck is thus far undefeated in 3 games passive economy plus desperado and grifters means a very rarely have a turn where i don't start with more money than I had the previous turn. I can get in anywhere and dig deep.

name: Collective Mill deck
description: John M lets you tag yourself. Use DLR to mill 3 cards. Collective then gains a click to remove the tag. Every turn, 3 cards get milled. 1 Woman in the Red Dress should be added and 1 Dirty Laundry removed. WitRD will allow me to see 1 card that's getting milled, or let the corp draw it, thus depleting R&D faster for a mill victory.

name: Maker take 1
description: Designed to get up and running rather quickly with a focus on R&D insulating against traces.

name: Beatwood Mac
description: Another variation on my something for everything deck

name: Ice denial
description:
Keep ICE down with Reina, Xanadu, Rook, and Cortez Chip. Trash rezzed ICE with Parasites, Data Sucker, and Wyrm. Derez ICE with Emergency Shutdown, and keep credits low with Vamp.

I've played this with good success with Whizzard; I haven't tried it yet with Reina but she fits the deck better.

name: Jintekilol
description:
Replicating Perfection makes running remotes not fun. Pop Up Window and Shadow on R&D, HQ, or Archives makes it even less so. After the first or second trap, most runners I've played this against just stop running remotes entirely.

Advancing traps is essential here, if not for the psychological game, then just for the Trick of Light. There's not much economy, and I've had to trash Thomas prematurely just to get credits from him. Always keep at least 4 credits to activate traps and snares.

This wasn't meant to be a flatlining deck, but that's how most games with it end. Snare + Private Security Force has won me a few games, somehow. Fetal AI behind a Neural Katana was another, but I still don't know why they didn't jack out.

I'd like Bullfrog to get more play than it does. It's not a very good card, but it is a very fun addition to the Jinteki mind game.

name: Funbox
description:
The idea is to have the icebreaker you need and to trash the ones you don't. FCC makes trashing worthwhile, Scavenge helps bring them back cheap, and LALA is a nice reset.

The Toolbox's credits can make runs free, the links save credits, and the memory is good for Battering Ram, Cyber Cypher, and Datasucker. I played around with Dinosaurus and Desperado, but I like Toolbox the best.

Economy in this deck was first provided by Magnum Opus, but I really like it with Data Dealer. Runs should be cheap with a good rig, so Notoriety isn't a bad recovery from the agenda point loss.

Datasucker is there for Yog.0 and Mimic, but I've had to trade those out for variable strength breakers to get through multiple Archers or the like.
Data Mined from the October Plugged In tour
